thread.title: STEM Co-Lab, at Desert Research Institute, holds grand opening
thread.title_full: STEM Co-Lab, at Desert Research Institute, holds grand opening

author: @KOLO8
title: STEM Co-Lab, at Desert Research Institute, holds grand opening
text:
STEM Co-Lab, at Desert Research Institute, holds grand opening
RENO, Nev. (KOLO) - The Robert Z. Hawkins Foundation STEM Co-Lab opened on the Desert Research Institute’s campus in Reno on Wednesday, Sept. 17.
As part of its grand opening celebration, there were tours of the co-lab, showcasing the Lending Library designed to loan Washoe County educators science and technology equipment to use in their classrooms or after-school programs.
There were also hands-on demonstrations including 3D printers, hydroponics, Photon Robots, atom theory, microscopes, Circuit Maker, and electricity and circuitry.
The co-lab has a dedicated space for educator professional development trainings and STEM education events for the community.
The STEM Co-Lab was funded with generous support from the Robert Z. Hawkins Foundation, which is dedicated to advancing STEM education in Northern Nevada.
In 1959, the non-profit research institute was founded “to empower experts to focus on science that matters,” according to the Desert Research Institute’s website. “We work with communities across the state – and the world – to address their most pressing scientific questions."
The institute is located at 2215 Raggio Parkway in Reno.
